intro: Dubyaea oligocephala, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dubyaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by pale brown seeds. Dubyaea oligocephala is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
